macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street Strengthens as Big Tech Bounces Back and Oil Rises
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 328 points or 0.7% as of 11 a.m. Eastern time, while the Nasdaq composite gained 0.8%. Big Tech stocks rebounded, contributing to the market uptick amid rising oil prices.

items.title: Stock Market Rally Sparked by Strong Taiwan Semiconductor Earnings
items.summary: Major indices rallied following robust earnings from Taiwan Semiconductor, with the market showing resilience despite weakening support from mega-cap leaders.

items.title: US Markets Close Lower: Dow Down 0.09%, S&P 500 Drops 0.53%
items.summary: On Wednesday, January 14, the Dow Jones closed at 49,149.63, down 42.36 points or 0.09%, while the S&P 500 fell 37.14 points or 0.53% to 6,926.60 amid weakening sentiment.

items.title: S&P 500 Declines 0.5%, Dow Falls 0.1%, Nasdaq Drops 1.0%
items.summary: US indices closed lower with S&P 500 down 0.5%, Dow Jones off 0.1%, and Nasdaq declining 1.0%; European markets mixed. November retail sales rose 0.6% m/m and producer prices increased 3.0% y/y.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: US Spot Bitcoin ETFs Record $1.7 Billion Inflows in Three Days as BTC Surpasses $97K
items.summary: US spot Bitcoin ETFs saw $1.7 billion in inflows over the last three days, reversing prior outflows and driving Bitcoin's price above $97,000 from recent $88,000 lows. This surge aligns with ongoing US crypto regulatory discussions amid market volatility.

items.title: Senate Delays Markup of CLARITY Act After Coinbase CEO Withdraws Support
items.summary: The Senate Banking Committee delayed markup of the CLARITY Act following Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong's withdrawal of support, calling it worse than no bill. Industry figures view this as a setback, with debates over SEC/CFTC roles, stablecoins, and DeFi.

items.title: Ethereum Hits $120 Billion Staking Record with 30% of Supply Locked
items.summary: Ethereum reached a milestone with nearly 30% of its circulating supply staked, totaling $120 billion, as Bitmine added $600 million to stake $6 billion. Analysts predict price surges for ETH, currently up 1% at $3,359, amid Bitcoin's 1.9% rise to $96,917.

items.title: Ex-SEC Chief Accountant Warns CLARITY Act Could Trigger Next FTX Collapse
items.summary: Former SEC Chief Accountant Lynn Turner cautioned that the CLARITY Act risks repeating FTX failures by weakening oversight, amid concerns over stablecoin yields, DeFi liability, and deposit risks up to $6.6 trillion. Senator Warren and bankers echo worries on SEC authority and loopholes.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Cognizant Releases 'New Work, New World 2026' Report: AI Could Unlock $4.5 Trillion in U.S. Labor Productivity
items.summary: Cognizant's updated study reveals AI is advancing faster than expected, potentially impacting 93% of U.S. jobs today and handling $4.5 trillion in tasks, with exposure scores 30% higher than prior 2032 forecasts and rising 9% annually. The report emphasizes skilling and human judgment to capture AI's value.

items.title: World Economic Forum Highlights Cognizant's Research Countering AI Bubble Fears
items.summary: New Cognizant analysis counters AI bubble speculation, estimating AI could add $1 trillion to U.S. GDP and affect $4.4 trillion in consumer purchases, with job exposure scores surging 30% beyond decade-long projections due to rapid AI progress.

items.title: Agentic AI Set for Key Progress in 2026 If CIOs Address Trust and Integration Challenges
items.summary: CIO.com reports hype around AI agents led to experimentation and failures in 2025, but 2026 could see adoption in collaborative workflows if organizations overcome LLM limitations, costs, and system integration issues, per experts like Gartner and Pega CTO.

items.title: Slingshot Aerospace Wins $27M U.S. Space Force Contract for AI-Driven Training Environment
items.summary: Slingshot Aerospace secured a $27 million deal to modernize the Space Force's TALOS AI-driven scenario training, emphasizing open APIs for integrating new sensors, data systems, and AI capabilities.

items.title: Stanford-Harvard Report: Clinical AI Booms with 1,200+ FDA-Cleared Tools, Excels in Prediction
items.summary: A new Stanford-Harvard report details AI's integration in medicine, including patient risk prediction up to 24 hours early, though diagnostic reasoning shows mixed results; over 1,200 tools cleared by FDA.

items.title: USGS Seeks AI/ML Expertise to Enhance Landsat Satellite Flight Operations
items.summary: The U.S. Geological Survey is partnering with AI and machine learning experts to improve Landsat satellite operations, soliciting input with responses due soon.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Video Game Industry M&A Hits Record $161 Billion
items.summary: The video game industry reached a record $161 billion in mergers and acquisitions, driven by major deals including the Public Investment Fund's $55 billion acquisition of Electronic Arts, Netflix's likely acquisition of Warner Bros, and Niantic's acquisition by Scopely. Drake Star predicts 2026 will remain buoyant with private equity investment and potential high-profile IPOs.

items.title: RuneScape Celebrates 25 Years with Major Announcements
items.summary: Jagex marks RuneScape's 25th anniversary with record investment and content development, including removal of the Treasure Hunter microtransaction system following a community vote. Old School RuneScape unveils an ambitious 2026 roadmap with new raids, leagues, and quests, while RuneScape: Dragonwilds has surpassed 1 million sales since early access.

items.title: Meta Closes Three VR Game Studios, Cuts 1,000 Employees
items.summary: Meta has shut down Twisted Pixel Games (Deadpool VR developer), Sanzaru Games (Asgard's Wrath studio), and Armature Studio (Resident Evil 4 VR), impacting 1,000 employees overall. The company is shifting its metaverse focus toward wearables and augmented reality glasses.

items.title: Ubisoft Cuts 55 Jobs at Massive Entertainment and Stockholm Studio
items.summary: Ubisoft announced layoffs of 55 employees at Massive Entertainment and Ubisoft Stockholm, described as unrelated to performance issues. The cuts follow voluntary redundancies in October 2025 and come after the company shut down its recently unionized Halifax studio.

items.title: Awesome Games Done Quick Raises $2.44 Million for Charity
items.summary: The Awesome Games Done Quick (AGDQ) live-streaming event, held January 6-10, raised $2.44 million for the Prevent Cancer Foundation. Streamers completed challenges including blindfolded Majora's Mask speedruns and Resident Evil using a Guitar Hero controller.

items.title: Arc Raiders Surpasses 12.4 Million Copies Sold
items.summary: Nexon announced that Arc Raiders has surpassed 12.4 million copies sold, up from 10 million at the end of December, indicating increasing sales momentum in early 2026.

items.title: Gaming Corps Partners with bet365 for Global Distribution
items.summary: Sweden-based game developer Gaming Corps announced a major global content partnership with bet365, making its game portfolio available to bet365's 100+ million registered customers across key iGaming markets including the UK.

items.title: Larian Studios Commits to Not Using Generative AI for Divinity Concept Art
items.summary: Baldur's Gate 3 developer Larian announced it will not use generative AI tools when creating concept art for its upcoming game Divinity, with CEO Swen Vincke stating this eliminates discussion about the origin of the artwork.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: TSMC Reports Stronger-Than-Expected Results Boosting Tech Stocks
items.summary: TSMC's upbeat outlook and strong results spurred a tech stock revival, with US equity futures rising and chip equipment stocks like ASML hitting record highs. The report signals robust demand in the semiconductor industry.

items.title: Dell Upgraded by Barclays Amid Tech Sector Gains
items.summary: Dell's stock rose after receiving an upgrade from Barclays, contributing to positive momentum in tech equities following TSMC's strong performance.
